Candidate Name:	Alexander Duncan
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		London, UK
QUALIFICATIONS

B.Sc. Hons, Computer Networking (First Class) – London Metropolitan University (2011)
Professional Licenses & Certifications:
CMNA (Certified Meraki Networking Associate) – Cisco Meraki (2015)
ITIL Certified – ITIL Foundation (2011)
Cisco Identity Services Engine for System Engineers (650-474 PAISESE) – Cisco (2014)
CCDA (Cisco Certified Design Associate) – Cisco (Exp. Apr 2020)
CCDP (Cisco Certified Design Professional) – Cisco (Exp. Apr 2020)

CCNP Route & Switch (Cisco Cert Candidate Name:	Alexander Duncan
PERSONAL DETAILS
Location: 		London, UK
QUALIFICATIONS
M.Sc., Network Management & Security (Distinction) – London Metropolitan University (2012)
B.Sc. Hons, Computer Networking (First Class) – London Metropolitan University (2011)
Professional Licenses & Certifications:
CMNA (Certified Meraki Networking Associate) – Cisco Meraki (2015)
ITIL Certified – ITIL Foundation (2011)
Cisco Identity Services Engine for System Engineers (650-474 PAISESE) – Cisco (2014)
CCDA (Cisco Certified Design Associate) – Cisco (Exp. Apr 2020)
CCDP (Cisco Certified Design Professional) – Cisco (Exp. Apr 2020)
CCNA (Cisco Certified Network Associate) – Cisco (Exp. Apr 2020)
CCNA Security – Cisco (Exp. Apr 2020)
CCNA Wireless – Cisco (Exp. Apr 2020)
CCNP Route & Switch (Cisco Certified Network Professional) – Cisco (Exp. Apr 2020)
PSE Professional – Palo Alto Networks (Exp. Feb 2020)
CAREER SUMMARY
2017 to date: Palo Alto Networks Inc. – London
Position: Systems Engineer
Currently he is aligned to the sector that focuses on automotive, transportation, utilities, and manufacturing.
His responsibilities include:
Presenting / creating solutions
Leading PoCs
Developing relationships with partner community
Gathering technical & business requirements
Working with other technology vendors to formalise a solution that integrates
Providing cyber security risk analysis
Optimising solutions that customers have currently invested in
Delivering training workshops for customers
Presenting at Tradeshows
Managing resources from other parts of the business to deliver support as well as technical assistance to the customer
Championing IoT and ICS/SCADA security solutions
2015 – 2017 Cisco
Position: Global Systems Engineer
In his role as a Global Systems Engineer, he was assigned to the TATA Account team (which is part of Global Enterprise Segment that is responsible for Cisco’s top 29 Clients). He was primarily focused on the Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) account. This role was primarily customer focused and his responsibilities were shaped by the need to identify and respond to the customer’s individual requirements.
Thus, he is experienced in:
Leading multiple $1M+ deals from a technical perceptive
Leading several Proof of Concept labs
Presenting to senior executives and customers
Gathering technical & business requirements
Creating solutions
Formulating and validating Bill of Materials
Creating reference architectures
Producing High Level Designs
Managing internal resources to counteract competitor threats
Supporting TAC resources to address network issues
Organising cyber threat clinics for customers and internal staff
Mentoring colleagues who were new to Cisco
Sep 2014 – Apr 2015 Accenture
Position: Network Engineering Consultant
While at Accenture, he was assigned to the Royal Bank of Scotland, where his primary focus was on a significant and high-risk divestment project. In this role, he was responsible for:
Being first point of contact for the client in relation to technical support
Network implementation
Ensuring that network transitions occurred efficiently and punctually
Supporting other teams in respect of wireless and security
Evaluating existing network designs
Participating in customer engagements and producing network designs as well as recommendations.
Creating network diagrams and implementation plans for new sites
Supervising network changes
Teaching junior network engineers networking concepts (CCNA/CCNP)
Organising technical engagements with Cisco
He left Accenture as the work life balance was becoming very difficult, with him being expected to work most weekends and 12-hour days during the week. Additionally, he was primarily centred around the RBS contract which Accenture subsequently lost. He was re-headhunted back into Cisco in 2015.
2012 – 2014 Cisco
2013 – 2014
Position: Virtual Systems Engineer – Security
Main role was to support Field Engineers and Account Managers by providing support from across a range of areas including technical support and validating network designs. This involved specialising in network security, with a particular focus on Cisco’s ISE (Identity Service Engine).
Responsibilities includ

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
